article.name: How to Integrate KnowBe4's KSAT Console with KCM GRC
article.title: How to Integrate KnowBe4's KSAT Console with KCM GRC
label_names: KCM and Knowbe4 security awareness training integration
article.body:
If your organization uses KnowBe4's Security Awareness Training (KSAT) console for training, you can integrate your KSAT console with your KCM GRC platform. You can use this integration to create automated KCM GRC tasks that will collect your users' KSAT training completions as evidence. Then, you can use these tasks to show your auditors that your organization is meeting its training requirements.

To set up this integration, you'll need to create a KSAT API token and then configure the integration in your KCM GRC platform. To complete this process, see the sections below.

Creating a KSAT API Token

To connect your KSAT console with your KCM GRC platform, you'll need to create a KSAT API token. 

To create a KSAT API token, follow the steps below:

  1. Log in to your KSAT console.
  2. Click your email address at the top-right corner of the page.
  3. From the drop-down menu that opens, select Account Settings.
  4. Navigate to Account Integrations > API.
  5. Click the Product API link. When you click this link, you'll be taken to the Product API subtab.
  6. At the top-right corner of the page, click the + Create New API Token button.
  7. Fill out the fields on the Create New API Token page.
  8. Click Create Token. The Product API Token pop-up window will open.
  9. Click the Product API token to copy the token. Make sure to save your copied API token somewhere that you can easily access. After you close this window, you will not be able to view this token again.
  10. Click OK.

After you've copied your new KSAT API token, continue to the Configuring the Integration section below. 

Configuring the Integration

After you copy your API token, you can configure the integration in your KCM GRC platform.

To configure the integration, follow the steps below:

  1. Log in to your KCM GRC platform. 
  2. At the top-right corner of the page, select Settings > Account Settings. 
  3. On the View Account page, select the Integrations subtab.
  4. In the KnowBe4 KSAT Console section of the page, click the Open button. When you click this button, the KnowBe4 KSAT Console page will open. 
  5. In the API Token field, paste the API token you copied in the Creating a KSAT API Token section above.
  6. Click the Connect button to connect to your KSAT console.

After you configure the integration, you can begin creating tasks to collect KSAT evidence. For more information about creating tasks for KSAT, see our KSAT Integration: How to Work with Tasks article.

images.alt:
This image displays a configuration screen section dedicated to API access settings, organized under the main heading **API**. The screen is structured into three subsections controlling different API types.

**General UI Elements:**
*   Blue text with a globe icon indicates a primary API access link.
*   Blue text with a book/person icon indicates a link to "Reference Documentation."
*   Question mark icons (`?`) next to primary links denote context-specific help or tooltips.

**1. Reporting API Section**
*   **Title:** Reporting API
*   **Access Control:** A checkbox labeled "**Enable Reporting API Access**" is present and currently selected (checked).
*   **Links:**
    *   Reporting API (link element with globe icon and help icon).
    *   Reference Documentation (link element with documentation icon).

**2. User Event API Section**
*   **Title:** User Event API
*   **Links:**
    *   User Event API (link element with globe icon and help icon).
    *   Reference Documentation (link element with documentation icon).

**3. Product API Section**
*   **Title:** Product API
*   **Access Control:** A checkbox labeled "**Enable KSAT Graph API Access**" is present and currently unselected (unchecked).
*   **Links:**
    *   Product API (link element with globe icon and help icon).

**Annotation:**
A large orange arrow is superimposed on the image, pointing specifically to the question mark help icon associated with the "Product API" link element.
images.context: you'll be taken to the Product API subtab.

images.alt:
This image displays a management console view focused on **API Token administration**.

**Context and Navigation:**
The interface utilizes tab navigation. The visible tabs are "Reporting API," "User Event API," and the currently selected tab, **"Product API."**

**Primary Call to Action:**
In the top right, a prominent blue button is labeled **"+ Create New API Token."** (Note: An instructional orange arrow is superimposed on the image pointing to this button.)

**API Token Listing (Data Table):**
A table lists existing API tokens with seven specific headers:

1.  **Key:** Displays the API key, which is obscured (e.g., "XXXXXXXXXX"). Includes a help/information icon (question mark in a circle).
2.  **Name:** (Obscured Data)
3.  **Product:** Lists the associated product (e.g., "KCM," "PhishER").
4.  **User:** (Obscured Data)
5.  **Expiration Date:** Displays the expiration date (e.g., 03/20/2024).
6.  **Status:** Uses graphical indicators:
    *   Green checkmark (✓) for active status (Rows 1 and 2).
    *   Red 'X' (✗) for inactive or expired status (Row 3).
7.  **Actions:** Contains a dropdown menu icon for token management (e.g., view details, revoke, or edit).

**Summary Footer:**
The bottom left indicates the total count of tokens currently displayed: **"Displaying all 3 rows."**
